We bring you the best hotels in Kolkata, rounded up area-wise to help you make your choice.The best hotels in KolkataThe best hotels in the Park Street areaThe best hotels in AJC Bose Road and Alipore areaThe best hotels on EM BypassThe best hotels in Central KolkataThe best hotels in New Town and Rajarhat areaThe best hotels in Salt LakeHeritage B&BsFurther afieldThe best hotels in the Park Street areaIf you want a mix of Kolkata’s underrated nightlife or the old-world charm of heritage buildings, we recommend hotels along Park Street and Park Circus. Shoppers have Quest Mall, the biggest in the city, as well as popular local haunts like New Market and Vardaan Market to loosen their purse strings. You are also close enough to Central and North Kolkata to take in remnants of the city’s colonial history, as well as Victoria Memorial, Indian Museum, and Jorasankho Thakur Bari (Rabindranath Tagore’s ancestral home).The Park Hotel KolkataThe Park Hotel KolkataThe Park Hotel Kolkata is a close-to-perfect choice for every kind of traveller. Located at the mouth of Kolkata’s most bustling neighbourhood, it’s a 149-key hotel equipped with all the modcons to cater to your every need. Sit back and relax at Aura Spa; follow it up with dining or dancing at one of the many pubs and restaurants within the premises—including city favourites Roxy, Tantra and Someplace Else as well as Aura, the poolside bar. Doubles from Rs6,000* plus taxes.MAKE A RESERVATIONKenilworth Hotel, KolkataKenilworth Hotel KolkataCourteous staff and warm, retro-chic accommodations that blend Kolkata’s colonial charm with modern sensibilities await you at Kenilworth. The property is located a convenient distance from the chaos, close enough to keep you minutes away from all the fun you may desire. There are 101 comfortable rooms and suites, a lovely outdoor setup for weddings, and a spa and salon for a spot of self-care. Doubles from Rs11,500* with breakfast, plus taxes.MAKE A RESERVATIONThe AstorVivek DasA few minutes from the city’s major attractions, this 1905-built boutique hotel is well connected to Kolkata’s business and leisure options. While its deluxe and luxury rooms and suites all come well-appointed, we recommend the heritage suite for the inviting four-poster bed and traditional aesthetics. Plus, its numerous dining options are a favourite among both city natives and travellers, especially its outdoor lounge Deck 88 and night club, Phoenix. Doubles from Rs8,000*.MAKE A RESERVATIONGlenburn Penthouse CalcuttaGlenburn Penthouse CalcuttaWalking distance from Victoria Memorial, Park Street and Maidan Park, the Glenburn Penthouse is a nine-suite boutique hotel on the roof of a modern office building in Central Kolkata. The views, as you can expect, are wondrous. A family-owned and managed property, the interiors are elegantly decorated with beautiful art and antiques. Tea from Darjeeling, where the family owns an estate, makes for the perfect pairing with the stay. An infinity pool, library, restaurant, gymnasium, spa and crafted tours of Kolkata are also on offer. Doubles from Rs14,000*, including breakfast.MAKE A RESERVATIONThe Elgin FairlawnThe Elgin FairlawnA step inside this heritage hotel evokes nostalgia. Housed in a structure from 1783, The Elgin Fairlawn is steeped in the influences of the many families that moulded the place over time. The lush greenery of the gardens, terraces and various open lounges make it an ideal winter stay, easily making one forget that they’re in the heart of a metropolitan city. The décor draws from the property’s colonial past, combining it with modern facilities. And Shashi Kapoor fans, Room No. 17, his favourite at The Elgin, was named after him. Doubles from Rs6,720* plus taxes.MAKE A RESERVATIONThe best hotels in AJC Bose Road and Alipore areaHotel Hindusthan InternationalHotel Hindusthan InternationalHHI, as it’s fondly known in the city, is located on Kolkata’s arterial AJC Bose Road. It features luxurious rooms, specialty restaurants, inviting lounges, open-air lawns, as well as Underground, one of Kolkata’s most happening night clubs. The spacious banquet halls and other business-friendly amenities also make the place suitable for work-related trips. Doubles from Rs5,185* plus taxes.MAKE A RESERVATIONTaj BengalTaj BengalA luxury landmark in downtown Kolkata, it comes with all the conveniences and comfort that the Taj Group is known for. The interiors were inspired by the city’s famed art, culture and heritage, woven together in a contemporary style. Indulge in Punjabi, Northwest Frontier and Bengali cuisines at Sonargaon, Chinese at Chinoiserie, or Mediterranean delights at Souk. When not enjoying the relaxing comfort of one of the grand rooms and suites, the spa on the premises is where you’ll want to be. While just a stone’s throw away from Kolkata zoo, the Taj Bengal is mere minutes from landmarks like Prinsep Ghat, Vidyasagar Sethu and Victoria Memorial. Doubles from Rs11,000* plus taxes for members.MAKE A RESERVATIONThe best hotels on EM BypassTo experience the ease of shunting between the northern and southern neighbourhoods of Kolkata, a hotel on EM Bypass is perfect. Its proximity to the airport, tourist hotspots like Science City, Nicco Park, Park Street and the Nalban Boating Complex, as well as the nightlife and fine-dining options of Salt Lake, are welcome bonuses.ITC Royal BengalITC Royal BengalFrom the architecture and interiors, to the splendid services and dining selections, everything about this property screams royalty. Only a little over four years old, the mesmerising lighting on its façade is already an icon of the city. LEED Platinum-certified, ITC Royal Bengal towers over all others in its vicinity, even its neighbouring sister property ITC Sonar. Pick from 456 rooms and suites, including 82 serviced apartments, and its seven dining destinations—the iconic Avartana, Grand Market Pavilion and The Brass Room among them—that come with all the culinary delights ITC is known for, like its dal bukhara and local Bengali specialities. Doubles from Rs13,570* plus taxes for members.MAKE A RESERVATIONITC SonarITC SonarDon’t be deceived by the traditional Bengali baganbari (farmhouse) style structure, for ITC Sonar comes with all the luxuries the group is known for. Located across the road from Science City, the property is a tranquil escape in itself—besides choosing from one of the 237 rooms and suites, you can relax by the koi and lily ponds, sit back with a book under lime and palm trees or opt for one of the many holistic treatments at Kaya Kalp, the spa. For meals, the aromas from Eden Pavilion, which serves local and international cuisine with ample vegetarian and vegan options, will call out to you all day long. Doubles from Rs10,620* plus taxes for members.MAKE A RESERVATIONJW Marriott Hotel KolkataJW Marriott Hotel KolkataUnderstated elegance is proudly on display at this 5-star accommodation. Besides well-appointed rooms and suites that boast wondrous views, the premises holds four distinctive dining options as well as the holistic Spa by JW. Expansive event spaces, including a spacious boardroom as well as an elegant bridal room, make this Marriott property perfect for both business and weddings. Doubles from Rs22,000*.MAKE A RESERVATIONVivanta Kolkata EM BypassLet’s start with one of their biggest perks—it’s a pet-friendly property! There are 197 urban studio-style rooms and plush suites, plus a rooftop gym and pool. The concierge service can help organise a tour of Kolkata’s landmarks, including visits to Jorasanko Thakurbari (Rabindranath Tagore’s ancestral home), Victoria Memorial and other locations that speak of the city’s cultural legacy. Doubles from Rs6,160* plus taxes.MAKE A RESERVATIONThe best hotels in Central KolkataLiterally the heart of the city, here is where Kolkata’s developing self merges with its colonial architectural history. Think New Market, Chowringhee, Bowbazar, College Street and even Park Street and Fort William a little distance away. Past meets the present in Central Kolkata, home to attractions such as Writers’ Building, St Paul’s Cathedral, Victoria Memorial and BBD Bagh, not to mention some of the city’s best street-food stalls.Polo Floatel KolkataPolo Floatel KolkataThis floating hotel brings you beautiful views of the Howrah Bridge over the Hooghly from its six different kinds of cabins. Besides its fine multicuisine fare, look forward to indulging in the freshest catch of the day. Also check out the various boat-related packages offered, such as a romantic candlelit dinner for couples, a private tour of the charms of Kolkata and fishing expeditions. Doubles from Rs5,000* plus taxes.MAKE A RESERVATIONThe Oberoi Grand, KolkataThe Oberoi GrandWith myriad stores and the bustling New Market in its vicinity, The Oberoi Grand, Kolkata comes as a breath of fresh air away from the chaos. Fondly called the ‘Grand Dame of Chowringhee,’ this urban sanctuary is Oberoi’s renowned hospitality at its best. Beyond the gilded doors are classic-contemporary rooms and suites, grand ballrooms, fine-dining spaces and spa beds to sink into. Curated Oberoi experiences, like the heritage walks featuring tours of Kolkata’s British history, spice routes and a wine trail, are the proverbial cherries on top. Doubles from Rs6,299*.MAKE A RESERVATIONThe LaLiT Great Eastern KolkataThe LaliT Great Eastern“Jewel of the East” and the “Best Hotel East of the Suez” are the two monikers Mark Twain conferred to the hotel, it’s believed. Built as Aukland Hotel in 1840, The LaLiT Great Eastern is purportedly the longest functioning luxury hotel in Asia, till its renovation in 2006; it was then unveiled with three different wings resembling three historic eras: Heritage Block I featuring the Victorian era, Heritage Block II featuring Edwardian architecture and the New Block for the Contemporary era. The 215-key property also boasts a guest book with names such as Rudyard Kipling, Mahatma Gandhi, Ho Chi Minh, Nikita Khruschev and Queen Elizabeth II. Today, it sits on the cusp of modern sensibilities and the legacy of our colonial past. Doubles from Rs7,500*.MAKE A RESERVATIONThe Peerless InnThe Peerless InnIts central location, warm services and proximity to popular tourist attractions, bazaars and restaurants makes The Peerless Inn an excellent choice for those visiting Kolkata. The Peerless also houses one of the city’s best spots serving authentic Bengali food—Aaheli. Its 168 premium rooms and suites are equipped with the conveniences of a luxurious setting. However, this hotel is even more perfect for corporate travellers, given its conference rooms, state-of-the-art business centre and free internet access throughout the premises. Doubles from Rs6,000*.MAKE A RESERVATIONThe best hotels in New Town and Rajarhat areaIt’s the happening part of the city dotted with swanky new hotels, restaurants and clubs. Not to mention how ideal the stretch is for late-night drives. It’s the closest one can get to the airport without being too far from all that Kolkata has to offer, along with a number of new attractions like the Aircraft Museum, Biswa Bangla Gate, Mother’s Wax Museum and Aquatica.Fairfield by Marriott KolkataFairfield by Marriott KolkataThere’s little that this Marriott property doesn’t offer in terms of comfort and luxury. While some of their spacious rooms come with magnificent views, their massive pool and fitness centre help nullify the effects of all the delectable food you can enjoy from their multicuisine menus. Add to that the impeccable service and the Starbucks in the same complex, this Fairfield is an easy pick. Doubles from Rs2,575*.MAKE A RESERVATIONNovotel Kolkata Hotel & ResidencesNovotel KolkataA pet-friendly property that comes with 340 rooms and 47 serviced apartments, Novotel was the upscale hotel that New Town was waiting for. All-day dining at The Square, which serves a number of international cuisines, as well as java from Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters at Cafe Joy will keep your caffeine cravings satiated. The 24x7 fitness centre will keep your calories in check, and the spa services will leave you feeling rejuvenated. Doubles from Rs7,615* plus taxes.MAKE A RESERVATIONTaj City Centre New Town, KolkataTaj City Centre New Town, KolkataWhile ‘city centre’ in its title may seem a misnomer geographically, this hotel comes with all the grandeur that the Taj Group is known for. The 137 rooms and 10 suites here offer a dreamy escape; the Taj Club Room features a jacuzzi that will make you never want to leave, while the J Wellness Spa calls to all those aware of Taj’s remarkable wellness treatments. Check with the staff on the tours they offer, and end the day at any of the iconic restaurants and bars. Doubles form Rs17,000* plus taxes.MAKE A RESERVATIONVedic Village Spa Resort, SikharpurVedic VillageIt’s the go-to retreat for some weekend fun as well as special occasions for residents of Kolkata. This boutique getaway is spread over 150 acres of a wealth of flora, its verdant greenery and sparkling lakes inviting migratory birds, butterflies and squirrels. The villas, built to resemble Bengal’s village homes, exude a sense of calm, which you can carry forward with Vedic Wellness packages and swimming in the tempting pool. Guests can also indulge in a number of sporting activities, while a variety of games can be organised for kids. Doubles from Rs5,500*.MAKE A RESERVATIONHoliday Inn Kolkata AirportTucked just 4.7 km from Kolkata’s international airport, Holiday Inn Kolkata Airport is a practical choice for business travellers and short-stay visitors. Its location near New Town, Eco Space and Salt Lake Sector V means you’re never too far from the city’s commercial hubs. The hotel’s 137 rooms are designed for comfort and efficiency, while shared spaces include a pool and fitness centre. On-site dining ranges from an all-day global menu at Social Kitchen to cocktails and grills at Urban Kitchen & Bar, with a side of nostalgic, eggless sweets at the Royal Bengal Sweet Company. Doubles from Rs7,000*.MAKE A RESERVATIONThe best hotels in Salt LakeSalt Lake brings you the best of the classic charm of Kolkata, heaped with its arts, culture and cuisine, amalgamating it with the developing IT world and mushrooming malls on every corner. Local attractions include Nicco Park (try your hand at the bowling alley here), Nalban, Science City, Salt Lake Stadium and malls like Mani Square and City Centre I.Hyatt Regency KolkataHyatt Regency KolkataOne of the oldest luxury hotels to earn the “landmark” status in the city, the Hyatt Regency continues to draw both travellers—for its lovely rooms, welcoming service and comfort—and residents of Kolkata—for its popular buffets and restaurants. You’ll find its lush garden teaming with people, especially in the colder months, with people looking to take in some winter sun in peace. Doubles from Rs8,030* plus taxes.MAKE A RESERVATIONRaajkutir, Kolkata – IHCL SeleQtionsRaajkutir KolkataEvery corner of this heritage property warrants a double take. The rajbari-style design—its 48 rooms, lush gardens and vintage artefacts included—takes one back to another era. The interiors also feature chequered marble flooring and Kota stone tiling, works from the Bengal School of Arts, and exquisite ceilings and other design elements that will guarantee a post—or five—on your Instagram. Adding to the cultural experience are the soulful melodies of folk singers that waft through the corridors, like the aromas of the era-authentic fare from the hotel’s award-winning restaurants. Doubles from Rs7,279* plus taxes.MAKE A RESERVATIONAltAir Boutique HotelAltAir Boutique HotelTake in the sights and sounds of Kolkata from this special boutique hotel, located on the 19th floor of Eco Centre, guaranteeing stunning views—particularly from the rooftop infinity pool. In fact, each room is dedicated to offering guests beautiful sights to fall asleep and wake up to. Refined rooms, exquisite, customisable menus and state-of-the-art business amenities make it the one-stop shop for all kinds of travellers, as well as those looking for that much-needed break with a peaceful staycation. Doubles from Rs5,897* plus taxes.MAKE A RESERVATIONHeritage B&BsCalcutta Bungalow Heritage Bed & BreakfastSwarup DuttaLocated in one of Kolkata’s busiest retail destinations, Shyam Bazar, Calcutta Bungalow is a restored 1920s townhouse with the classic architectural elements of the decades gone by. Six well-appointed bedrooms, tastefully decorated by celebrated local designer Swarup Dutta, reminds guests to enjoy the slow pace of life. Run by the folks behind Calcutta Walks, this boutique hotel is a restored townhouse from the 1920s that harks back to the olden architecture the city is known for. Its greenery-infused rooftop is a great spot for yoga or to simply hang out. Doubles from Rs14,160* plus taxes.MAKE A RESERVATIONThe Ivy HouseThe Ivy HouseEnjoy breakfast or unwind with a book under the shade of a mango tree, or head out for a stroll in the lush neighbourhood of Ballygunge. The Ivy House is a welcome nook in the noise of the city. Warm, inviting interiors make you feel at home in its four rooms, each named after a flower and equipped with all the essentials a guest may need. The foodies among you will enjoy the proximity to some Kolkata popular restaurants in the vicinity, like 6 Ballygunge Place. Doubles from Rs5,600* plus taxes.MAKE A RESERVATIONThe Lalbari Heritage BungalowThe Lalbari Heritage BungalowThe red-brick structure, green windows and wooden bannisters are reminiscent of the architectural style that’s been around in Bengal since the British Raj. This vintage Lalbari is around a century old and shields you from the chaos of the city. Located just off Alipore, near Kalighat, it’s steeped in history, having played host to the likes of Ravi Shankar, Indira Gandhi and even Mahatma Gandhi over the years. The host ensures impeccable hospitality, making the bungalow perfect for travellers hankering for a taste of old-school Calcutta. Doubles from Rs6,000* with taxes.MAKE A RESERVATIONFurther afieldScenic views, the serenity of the Hooghly, a short road trip and great food—these properties a short drive away Kolkata make for perfect weekend getaways for all these reasons and more.The Ffort Raichak, Falta, Diamond HarbourThe Ffort RaichakAnother favourite weekend getaway among Kolkata residents, Ffort Raichak is housed in a magnificent fort—as the name suggests—with its rooms and suites all boasting lovely views of the river. Also available to book are Ffort Villas, luxurious apartments designed as English clubhouses that overlook the sprawling North Lawns of property and come with a private plunge pool. The property’s restaurants—sports lounge Footloose, Bengali food joint Sonar Tori and multi-cuisine restaurant Reflections—leave room for little error in culinary offerings. The Ffort Suites has another multi-cuisine restaurant, The Courtyard, for quick bites. Doubles from Rs8,000*.MAKE A RESERVATIONThe Rajbari Bawali, RaypurThe Rajbari BawaliWhen in Bengal, the rajbari experience is a must. And if you wish to take it up a royal notch, there’s The Rajbari Bawali, roughly 2 hours from Kolkata. This 300-year-old boutique hotel reflects its zamindari heritage in design, comfort and luxury. The 4-acre property offers plenty of room for strolls to build your appetite for all the delectable food at their four in-house restaurants, and cosy rooms to rest in afterward. Romantic dinners and sundowners can be arranged on request, making this rajbari a beautiful couple’s getaway. Doubles from Rs8,000* plus taxes.MAKE A RESERVATIONThe Denmark Tavern, SeramporeThe Denmark TavernLocated by the Hooghly in Serampore, around 90 minutes from Kolkata, this boutique property by The Park Hotels is worth the drive, their pastel-hued rooms and suites a treat for the senses. In addition to its serene surroundings, European architecture and warm hospitality, guests can enjoy delightful multi-cuisine fare at The Tavern, try their hand at some pool while sipping on their signature cocktails at The Courtyard, or simply take in the views from The Hooghly Balcony. Doubles from Rs4,599*.MAKE A RESERVATION*Prices are subject to change.All products are independently selected by our editors.
